value.name: An Asian American Teen Was Having A Mental Health Crisis When Police Killed Him
value.description: Christian Hall’s parents brought him to America in hopes of giving him a better life. Instead, he fell victim to institutional failures that harm many others who don’t fit the “model minority” myth. In his final moment of crisis,

value.name: ‘Jeffrey Westerfield’ Facebook Post
value.description: Viral posts purportedly describing the death of law enforcement officer Jeffrey Westerfield on his 47th birthday circulated in May 2021, co-opting language of the Black Lives Matter movement.

value.name: It’s Past Time to End the Federal Militarization of Police
value.description: For example, Baton Rouge police received a helicopter mere months after the 2016 police killing of Alton Sterling, and NYPD received two mine-resistant vehicles (MRAPs) just a couple of years after the 2014 police killings of Akai Gurley and Eric Garner.

value.name: Why The Chinese Community Shouldn’t Rally Around Indicted Cop Peter Liang
value.description: Startled by the sound of Akai Gurley and his girlfriend entering the landing below, Liang fired one shot, which ricocheted off the wall and into Gurley, killing him. It hardly bears mentioning ...

value.description: For example, Baton Rouge police received a helicopter mere months after the 2016 police killing of Alton Sterling, and NYPD received two mine-resistant vehicles just a couple of years after the 2014 police killings of Akai Gurley and Eric Garner.

value.name: 110 Black Men And Boys Killed By Police

value.name: America uprising: Scholars reflect on the death of George Floyd. Plus, 10 tips for journalists covering protests against police violence.
value.description: Nearly a dozen scholars on policing, economic and health inequality and media narratives reflect on the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis.
